repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
1. Fixes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4158 and https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4365 (although a better implementation is probably desirable long-term)
2. Conditionally excludes some code that was used to emulate vectorcall on older versions that I think is no longer needed (and which is broken on 3.11)
3. Tries to add 3.11 to the CI

I can split this up into 3 PRs if needed, but testing all 3 at once seemed like the most useful thing to start with

comment_data.body: This can probably go entirely actually... I'll do it next revision
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1625,13 +1625,13 @@ def shortDescription(self):
         return self._shortDescription
 
 try: # Py2.7+ and Py3.2+
-    from unittest.runner import _TextTestResult
+    from unittest.runner import _TextTestResult as TextTestResult

commit.message:
Basic replacement for PyCode_New*

Optimized versions would be nice, but this is intended to work
sufficiently to start testing

Disable introspection of frame object with vectorcall

This feature looked to only be used for early Python versions
that don't have the full vectorcall protocol (and the
contents of the frame object are changed in Python 3.11)

Try to fix v3.10 in CI

So that it doesn't find v3.1

Fix PyCode_New replacement

Turns out that the constructor doesn't take keyword args

Back to 3.10-dev

(because I can't make 3.10 work on its own)

Handle exception state

It should be possible to get a code object while an exception
is set.

title: Initial support for Python 3.11
